image.altText: Holly smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Holly Bowles, 19, has died in a Thailand hospital from methanol poisoning linked to Laos, which also claimed the life of her friend, Bianca Jones.

title.children: Second Melbourne teenager Holly Bowles dies, bringing Laos methanol poisoning death toll to six

image.altText: Nana Backpacker Hostel

props.synopsis: The owner of a backpackers hostel where two young Australians were staying before they fell violently ill from methanol poisoning has been detained by police for questioning in Laos.

title.children: Laos police detain owner of backpacker hostel where Australian teens were staying before methanol poisoning

image.altText: A crowd of people in red hats

props.synopsis: The family of 19-year-old Isla Bell, who was allegedly killed by a man in Melbourne last month, have joined a march in the heart of the city to demand an end to violence against women.

title.children: Isla Bell's family attend anti-violence march in Melbourne

image.altText: A young girl in a forest

props.synopsis: A County courtroom has heard "rare, compelling, and unusual circumstances" have spared 27-year-old Chrystle Kemp from jail over a 2023 fatal crash that claimed the life of her niece and the unborn child of a pregnant driver in regional Victoria.

title.children: Driver avoids jail for crash that killed her niece and an unborn baby in emotional sentencing

image.altText: Mr Vo wears a black leather jacket and carries a green shopping bag while his wife holds his arm and covers her face.

props.synopsis: A four-wheel drive transformed into a "lethal weapon" when a man who had barely driven before got behind the wheel and crashed into two young boys in Melbourne's west last year.

title.children: 'Shocking error': Unlicensed driver who pinned boy between vehicles sentenced to 10 months in jail

image.altText: A group of young men in AFL jerseys sit together on steps for a photo

props.synopsis: The 2024 AFL draft has been completed, with all 18 clubs adding to their lists with players they hope will be stars of the future. Here's who your club selected and what it means for your team.

title.children: How did your club fare at the AFL draft? Every team's haul analysed

image.altText: A close-up of a large, ornate wooden door at the front of Victoria's Parliament house

props.synopsis: The Victorian premier says a Memorandum of Understanding between the government and the Israeli Ministry of Defence signed in December 2022 won't be renewed As the state focuses on other "strategic opportunities".

title.children: Victorian government says agreement with Israel's defence ministry will not be renewed

image.altText: Michelle Ananda-Rajah is sitting down wearing a pale blue blazer and a multi-coloured scarf.

props.synopsis: Labor MP Michelle Ananda-Rajah will attempt to make the switch from the House to the Senate as a Victorian Labor candidate at next year's election.

title.children: With no seat to call home, this Labor MP is eyeing off an 'unlikely' switch to the Senate

image.altText: Raya Eloshaiker and Tianna Valvo stand next to each other in a clinical setting in a hospital

props.synopsis: When Tianna was 12 she was diagnosed with leukaemia and placed in an isolation pod for five months. Fortunately she became friends with fellow patient Raya, and the pair have now returned to the medical world — this time as students.

title.children: Two teenagers were diagnosed with leukaemia during COVID. Then, a friendship bloomed

image.altText: A composite image showing five writers

props.synopsis: Organisers of the Summer Reading for MPs campaign say they're not trying to change minds, but they believe reading can provide a "better understanding of the present through the lens of history".

title.children: Australian authors send all federal MPs 5 books about the Israel-Gaza war to read over summer

image.altText: Members of Victoria's Aboriginal communities gather in the sun, including a young child holding an Aboriginal flag.

props.synopsis: For the first time, an Australian government has sat opposite a collective of Aboriginal communities in a bid to negotiate a treaty, in recognition of their sovereign rights over land colonised without their consent.

title.children: Victorian treaty talks begin, in historic first for Aboriginal people and Australian governments

image.altText: a backyard with home made batteries built

props.synopsis: More people are cobbling together dangerous backyard power storage systems, and Victoria's energy safety regular says they are an "explosion waiting to happen".

title.children: Homemade batteries for solar storage and crypto mining are a 'ticking timebomb', regulator warns

image.altText: A smiling woman with dark hair, blonde edges, holds baby against a pink wall, photos of colourful hands on the wall.

props.synopsis: A program in Victoria's East that helps teenage parents stay in school is celebrating 10 years of operation.

title.children: Jade was worried she won't be able to graduate when she fell pregnant at 17. Then her school stepped in

image.altText: A composite image of a Japanese man, with a pair of rainbow socks and grey hoodie.

props.synopsis: Can clothing disrupt a fair trial? That's a question before the courts in Japan.

title.children: Cover that rainbow: Japanese lawsuit challenges the right of judges to police clothing

image.altText: A woman sits in hospital receiving dialysis treatment.

props.synopsis: Hayley Van Hostauyen was 14 weeks pregnant with her daughter Sage when she was diagnosed with chronic kidney disease, and now spends 20 hours a week on dialysis.

title.children: 'There has to be a better way': Dialysis patients consider stopping treatment due to impact on lives

image.altText: Katy Perry smiles in a crystal stripes and stars bikini top, in a make up look resembling Rosie the Riveter.

props.synopsis: A string of legal action was first launched in June 2009 over a trademark held by Katie Jane Taylor, who uses her birth name to design and sell clothes under the brand Katie Perry.

title.children: Katy Perry defeats Sydney fashion designer in federal court following 13-year-long battle

image.altText: A stock market board shows prices going up

props.synopsis: Local shares have ended the week on a positive note, while Bitcoin continued to close in on $US100,000. Coles executives were grilled on supplier deals and WiseTech shares fell after its annual meeting. Look back on how it unfolded on the markets blog.

title.children: ASX 200 and Bitcoin price climb to fresh records, WiseTech Global shares slump — as it happened

image.altText: A woman bends down in a wide salt lake with a spoon and blue ice cream container

props.synopsis: With a spoon and an ice-cream container this sheep and salt farmer harvests in her own backyard.

title.children: How a salt lake considered a 'waste of country' became a business opportunity

image.altText: Protesters hold Gautam Adani and Narendra Modi faces

props.synopsis: From a shy school dropout to one of India's richest and most influential people, Gautam Adani has now been accused of bribery by US prosecutors.

title.children: From shy school dropout to billionaire accused of bribery: Who is Gautam Adani?

image.altText: Young woman in glasses

props.synopsis: A preliminary brief of evidence released by the Melbourne Magistrates' Court reveals what police allege happened to 19-year-old Isla Bell.

title.children: A timeline of the events surrounding the alleged murder of Isla Bell, according to police

image.altText: A sign reading WINNER EUROVISION SONG CONTEST 2024 SWITZERLAND on a stage, with a crowd below

props.synopsis: Basel voters are expected to decide on Sunday whether they should spend tens of millions of dollars to host the 2025 Eurovision Song Contest, with opponents decrying a "waste" of public funds for a "blasphemous" music performance.

title.children: Swiss region to vote on cost of 'blasphemous' Eurovision 2025

image.altText: A phone displaying the meta logo sits on a computer keyboard

props.synopsis: The tech company — which owns Instagram and Facebook — says it will respect any age limits but believes the bill is being rushed without "adequate consultation or evidence".

title.children: Meta says social media ban for under 16s is 'out of step' with research — as it happened

image.altText: Donald Trump looks sideways while standing at a podium

props.synopsis: The next eight weeks leading up to Donald Trump's January 20 inauguration will be both dangerous and decisive in terms of the future of the Ukraine war.

title.children: This could be the final phase of the Ukraine war — and we're starting to see the 'Trump factor' kick in

image.altText: Three women smile at the camera, the lower one has white hair and the one on the right holds and iPad.

props.synopsis: The family of a Victorian man who died in a fire at his rental home has been fighting for smoke alarm reforms ever since. The new reforms will now require landlords to conduct yearly checks on all rentals.

title.children: Some long-term or periodic leases are exempt from smoke alarm laws. This family has fought for change

image.altText: Jussie Smollett at a red carpet event

props.synopsis: Jussie Smollett was convicted on charges of staging a racist and homophobic attack against himself in 2019.

title.children: Empire actor Jussie Smollett's conviction in 2019 hoax attack overturned

image.altText: McLaren F1 driver Oscar Piastri smiles as he takes a phone picture of teammate Lando Norris (back to camera)

props.synopsis: Australian driving ace Oscar Piastri says he's been freed from being a support act to Lando Norris for the rest of the season in Formula One.

title.children: Piastri says he has been freed up from McLaren orders to let him go for F1 glory

image.altText: A court sketch of a woman with dark skin in a suit wearing handcuffs.

props.synopsis: A Perth grandmother who claims a love scammer tricked her into taking two kilograms of methamphetamine into Japan has told a court she had met romantic interests overseas before.

title.children: Accused Perth drug smuggler travelled overseas to meet other romantic interests before alleged Japan 'love scam', trial told

image.altText: Netanyahu with his fingers up to his nose looking down

props.synopsis: While the chances of Benjamin Netanyahu travelling and being arrested are very low, an ICC arrest warrant will affect Israel's allies who now must consider whether their support for Israel is more important than their support of international institutions and treaties.

title.children: The ICC's arrest warrant for Netanyahu may not change the war, but it could affect Israel's allies

image.altText: A young man crouching in front of a car.

props.synopsis: Spencer Shumski, 20, is on trial for the alleged stabbing murder of Clint Allen, 38, after a night out at a Sale pub.

title.children: Clint Allen had been at the pub to celebrate his wife's birthday. He never made it home

image.altText: A woman with dark hair smiles in a selfie in front of a river in regional area

props.synopsis: The number of people dreaming of an escape to the country has doubled over the last 18 months. But experts are concerned the infrastructure isn't ready for it.

title.children: More people keen on a regional relocation, but report warns 'fundamentals' are deterring them

image.altText: A woman stands next to a large painting of herself dressed in a yellow gown and feather boa

props.synopsis: Broken Hill local June Marie Bennett, who played Shirl in The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert, is remembered by friends and family as "a born performer" with an "incredible love for life".

title.children: Outback icon known for role in cult classic Priscilla, Queen of the Desert dies aged 85

image.altText: An illustration shows a pregnant woman sitting cross-legged while a woman with halo leans down to touch her belly

props.synopsis: They check the baby's position and listen to the heartbeat, but they aren't qualified midwives. Parents say a "dangerous" new breed of birth worker has emerged to fill the gap for women wanting to birth outside hospital.

title.children: 'Sovereign midwife' who thought baby's shoulder was a head linked to three baby deaths
